dialog.teller: the bottom three fifths of the image is ALL water
There is only mountains and sky behind. The mountains cover most of the back with a sky at the top
dialog.drawer: So the sky is about five percent of the picture at the top? Are the mountains angled diagonally or straight?

dialog.teller: Mountains start at very top left corner and come down one 5th of the way. Move along right and then back up to right corner
dialog.drawer: So both the top left corner and top right corner have mountain. Where is the rise back up, how far from the center of the photo?

dialog.teller: You almost have it perfect, just make the left mountain come at a diagonal angle and then it slowly rises to the right top corner
dialog.drawer: Any trees or sand or anything else to draw in?

dialog.teller: Just mountain. You have to make the left one come down diagonal a little more, like it's sloping toward the bottom right corner
